objective.first: Full-time employment opportunity at a consumer-facing mobile or web company
objective.second: using and growing my skills in iOS, React, Node.js and JavaScript.

experience.title: Nest Labs, Palo Alto, CA
experience.subtitle: Web Applications Software Engineering Intern, May - August 2017
experience.description: A consumer device company intended "to create a home that takes care of the people inside it and the world around it." Developed:

infoList.description: Features that leverage new Web APIs. Architected the system for multiple platforms. Worked directly with multiple teams. Documented the implementation and deployment strategies.
Dynamic pucks for displaying device state in the "spaces" view.
A client for the Redux store that reflects localStorage state.
React views displaying Redux store data to replace legacy Backbone views.

experience.title: Tidepool, San Francisco, CA
experience.subtitle: Software Intern, June - August 2015; May - August 2016
experience.description: A non-profit startup developing a secure data platform and applications for people living with Type 1 Diabetes. Developed:

infoList.description: A command-line toolkit for data processing, analysis, and conversion of data to xlsx format.
A client-side data visualization for generating printed reports.
An iOS framework for interfacing with data ingestion REST APIs.
An iOS application to add context to diabetes data.

experience.title: VandyApps, Student Organization
experience.subtitle: President, May 2016 - May 2017; Vice President, January - May 2016
experience.description: A club for students interested in expanding their software development skills and preparing to be industry-ready engineers.

infoList.description: Coordination of weekly general body meetings including guest speakers, tech talks, and learning sessions.
Fundraising for club-sponsored events and resources, including our tech library.
Preparation and execution of club-sponsored hack nights and coding competitions.
Development of teaching materials for introductory iOS sessions.

experience.title: Teaching Assistant and Grader
experience.subtitle: Web-based System Architecture Class, January 2017 - present; Data Structures Class, January - December 2016

infoList.description: Designing and grading biweekly programming projects and assignments.
Student support via weekly office hours.
Grading of weekly quizzes, two midterms, and the final exam.
Web-based System Architecture prepares students to be full-stack web developers in React, Node.js, MongoDB, and Redis.
Data Structures introduces students to data structures and applications, problem solving techniques, and software design.

experience.title: Undergraduate Research Project, January 2017 - present
experience.description: Independent study course developing Quizinator, a web-based application to allow professors to easily and securely administer quizzes and exams to students. Developing the client with React, React Router, React Redux, and Material-UI. Developing the server with Node.js, Express, MongoDB, and Redis.
